title: Classic Hockey Legends
description: Hit the ice and remember the puck-handling heroes and legendary moments from hockey's most exciting decades!

questions.question: Gordie Howe, known as 'Mr. Hockey,' played professionally in how many decades?
Wayne Gretzky, 'The Great One,' set an NHL record by scoring how many goals in the 1981-82 season?
Bobby Orr revolutionized hockey by being an offensive defenseman. Which team did he play for during his prime years?
Bobby Orr's famous flying goal in the 1970 Stanley Cup Finals, captured in an iconic photograph, was scored against which team?
Maurice 'Rocket' Richard became the first NHL player to score how many goals in a single season in 1945?
The Montreal Canadiens won five consecutive Stanley Cup championships from 1956 to 1960. Who was their legendary coach?
The 1980 'Miracle on Ice' saw the U.S. Olympic hockey team defeat which heavily favored opponent?
Who coached the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team that pulled off the Miracle on Ice?
The 'Original Six' NHL teams included the Canadiens, Maple Leafs, Red Wings, Bruins, Rangers, and which other team?
The Philadelphia Flyers of the 1970s were known by what intimidating nickname?
Wayne Gretzky was traded from the Edmonton Oilers to which team in the blockbuster 1988 trade?
Gordie Howe played his first NHL season at what remarkably young age?
The NHL trophy awarded to the league's most valuable player each season is named after which person?
Jacques Plante revolutionized hockey in 1959 by becoming the first goalie to regularly wear what piece of equipment?
The 1972 Summit Series between Canada and the Soviet Union was decided by a last-minute goal scored by which Canadian player?
